privacyPolicy:
Yet Another Wiki Privacy Policy

Last Updated: November 25, 2024

Welcome!

Hi there! We're glad you're interested in learning about how Yet Another Wiki handles your privacy. We believe in keeping things straightforward and transparent, so we've written this privacy policy to be as clear and readable as possible while covering all the important details you need to know.

1. Introduction

1.1 Purpose of This Policy

This privacy policy explains how Yet Another Wiki ("we," "us," or "our") collects, uses, and protects your information when you use our wiki platform. We value your privacy and aim to protect it as if it were our own.

1.2 About Yet Another Wiki

Yet Another Wiki is a Next.js-based wiki platform owned and operated by John Overton (sole proprietor). Our platform allows users to create, share, and manage wiki content while maintaining appropriate privacy and security measures.

1.3 Contact Information

If you have any questions or concerns about this privacy policy or our privacy practices, please contact us at:

- Email: info@jroverton.com
- Owner: John Overton

1.4 Scope of This Policy

This privacy policy applies to:
- The YetAnotherWiki.com website
- All related services and features
- User accounts and profiles
- Any interaction with our platform

1.5 Your Agreement

By using Yet Another Wiki, you agree to the collection and use of information as described in this policy. We encourage you to read this document carefully to understand our practices regarding your personal information.

1.6 Important Note About Security

While we implement strong security measures to protect your information, your security on Yet Another Wiki also depends on your own best practices. John Overton and Yet Another Wiki cannot be held liable for any information you inadvertently disclose through your own actions.

1.7 Our Core Privacy Principles

- We only collect information that's necessary for the platform's operation
- We don't sell your information to anyone
- We use your information solely for business activities on YetAnotherWiki.com
- We encrypt sensitive information like passwords and security questions
- We respect your privacy rights and give you control over your information

2. Information We Collect

2.1 Account Registration Information

When you create an account on Yet Another Wiki, we collect:
- Your name
- Email address
- Password (encrypted)
- Security question answers (encrypted)

2.2 Automatically Collected Information

Our system automatically collects certain information for security and operational purposes:
- IP addresses
- Session data
- Login timestamps
- Browser type and version
- Operating system information
- Pages visited within the wiki

2.3 How We Collect Information

We collect information in two ways:
- Directly from you when you provide it (such as during registration)
- Automatically through our platform's operation (such as IP addresses and session data)

2.4 Session Data

To maintain security and provide a better user experience, we track:
- Session duration
- Login attempts
- Last active timestamp
- Session identifiers
This information helps us protect accounts from unauthorized access and maintain platform security.

2.5 Security and Authentication Data

For account security purposes, we:
- Store all passwords using industry-standard encryption
- Encrypt security question answers
- Never store passwords in plain text
- Maintain secure session tokens
- Track failed login attempts to prevent abuse

2.6 Optional Information

You may choose to provide additional information when using our platform, such as:
- Profile information
- Wiki contributions
- Comments or feedback
This information is stored in association with your account but is not required for basic platform use.

2.7 Information We Don't Collect

To maintain your privacy, we do not collect:
- Credit card or payment information
- Social security numbers
- Government identification
- Personal documents
- Information about your activities on other websites

3. How We Use Your Information

3.1 Core Platform Operations

We use your information to:
- Maintain and operate your wiki account
- Authenticate your identity when you log in
- Process and display your wiki contributions
- Provide customer support when needed
- Send important account notifications

3.2 Security and Protection

Your information helps us:
- Prevent unauthorized access to accounts
- Detect and prevent abuse of our platform
- Monitor for suspicious activity
- Protect the wiki from spam and malicious content
- Maintain the overall security of our platform

3.3 Session Management

We use session data to:
- Keep you logged in securely
- Track active sessions
- Protect against session hijacking
- Monitor for unusual activity
- Ensure proper account logout

3.4 Communication

We may use your email address to:
- Send account verification messages
- Provide important security alerts
- Notify you about significant platform changes
- Respond to your support requests
- Send password reset links when requested

3.5 Platform Improvement

We analyze usage data to:
- Improve wiki functionality
- Fix technical issues
- Enhance user experience
- Optimize platform performance
- Identify areas needing improvement

3.6 Legal Compliance

We may use information to:
- Comply with legal obligations
- Respond to legal requests when required by law
- Protect our legal rights
- Enforce our terms of service

3.7 What We Don't Do With Your Information

We want to be clear that we do not:
- Sell your personal information
- Share your data with third parties
- Use your information for marketing purposes
- Create user profiles for advertising
- Track you across other websites

4. Data Storage and Security

4.1 Data Storage Practices

Our data is stored:
- On secure servers located in the United States
- Using industry-standard database security practices
- With regular backups to prevent data loss
- In an encrypted format for sensitive information

4.2 Security Measures

We protect your data through:
- HTTPS encryption for all web traffic
- Secure password hashing using modern algorithms
- Encrypted storage of security question answers
- Regular security audits and updates
- Monitoring for unauthorized access attempts

4.3 Access Controls

We maintain strict access controls by:
- Limiting administrator access to essential personnel
- Requiring strong authentication for system access
- Maintaining detailed access logs
- Regularly reviewing access permissions
- Implementing role-based access control

4.4 Data Retention

We retain your data:
- As long as your account remains active
- For a reasonable period after account deletion to prevent abuse
- In accordance with legal requirements
- Until you request complete data removal
- In backup systems for disaster recovery

4.5 Security Incident Response

In the event of a security incident, we will:
- Investigate the cause immediately
- Notify affected users as required by law
- Take steps to prevent similar incidents
- Work with security experts if necessary
- Implement additional safeguards as needed

4.6 Encryption Practices

We use encryption for:
- All passwords stored in our system
- Security question answers
- Session tokens
- Database backups
- Sensitive user information

4.7 Your Security Responsibilities

To help maintain security, you should:
- Choose a strong, unique password
- Keep your security questions private
- Never share your login credentials
- Log out when using shared computers
- Report any suspicious activity to us

5. Information Sharing and Disclosure

5.1 Our Sharing Policy

We maintain a strict policy of not sharing your personal information. Specifically:
- We do not sell your data to any third parties
- We do not share your information for marketing purposes
- We do not provide your data to advertisers
- We do not distribute email addresses or personal details
- We keep your security question answers strictly confidential

5.2 Limited Operational Sharing

We may need to share limited information with:
- Our hosting provider to maintain the service
- Security services that help protect the platform
- Database backup services
These providers are bound by strict confidentiality agreements and only use your information to provide necessary services.

5.3 Legal Requirements

We may disclose information if:
- Required by law
- Served with a valid court order
- Needed to respond to a valid legal process
- Necessary to protect our legal rights
- Required to prevent harm or illegal activities

5.4 Account Information

Your public wiki contributions may be visible to:
- Other registered users
- Site visitors (if set to public)
- Search engines (if set to public)
However, your email address and security information remain private.

5.5 Business Transfers

If Yet Another Wiki is ever:
- Sold
- Merged with another company
- Transferred to new ownership
We will notify you before any personal information is transferred and becomes subject to a different privacy policy.

5.6 Aggregate Data

We may share:
- Anonymous usage statistics
- Aggregated user behavior data
- Platform performance metrics
This information never includes personal identification details.

5.7 Third-Party Links

While our wiki may contain links to other websites:
- We are not responsible for their privacy practices
- Your information is not automatically shared with them
- Their privacy policies may differ from ours
- We recommend reviewing their policies separately

6. User Rights and Controls

6.1 Your Account Rights

As a Yet Another Wiki user, you have the right to:
- Access your personal information
- Update your account details
- Change your password and security questions
- Control the visibility of your contributions
- Delete your account and associated data

6.2 Accessing Your Information

You can access your information by:
- Logging into your account
- Viewing your profile settings
- Reviewing your contribution history
- Checking your account activity log
- Requesting a data export of your information

6.3 Updating Your Information

You can modify your information by:
- Editing your profile settings
- Updating your email address
- Changing your security questions
- Modifying your password
- Updating your display name

6.4 Account Deletion

If you choose to delete your account:
- You can request account deletion through your settings
- We will confirm your identity before proceeding
- Your personal information will be removed
- Public contributions may remain unless specifically requested
- Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone

6.5 Data Retention After Deletion

After account deletion:
- We retain minimal information to prevent abuse
- Backup archives may contain data for up to 90 days
- Some information may be retained for legal compliance
- Public contributions remain unless specifically removed
- Associated logs are automatically purged after 90 days

6.6 Communication Preferences

You can control:
- What notifications you receive
- How we communicate with you
- Whether to receive security alerts
- Account-related communications
Note: Some system notifications cannot be disabled for security reasons

6.7 Data Portability

We support your right to:
- Export your wiki contributions
- Download your account information
- Transfer your content
- Receive a copy of your data
- Move your information as needed

7. Children's Privacy

7.1 Age Restrictions

To protect young users:
- Users must be 13 years or older to create an account
- We do not knowingly collect information from children under 13
- Parents should supervise children's internet usage
- Underage accounts will be terminated when discovered
- We comply with the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA)

7.2 Verification Process

We take reasonable steps to verify age by:
- Requiring birth date during registration
- Monitoring content and behavior patterns
- Investigating reports of underage users
- Implementing appropriate security measures
- Responding promptly to age-related concerns

7.3 Discovery of Underage Users

If we discover a user is under 13:
- The account will be immediately suspended
- All personal information will be deleted
- Parents will be notified when possible
- Any content created will be removed
- No refunds will be issued for paid services

7.4 Parental Rights

Parents or legal guardians:
- Can request information about their child's account
- May request deletion of their child's information
- Must provide verification of their identity
- Should report underage accounts
- Can contact us with concerns about youth privacy

7.5 Educational Use

For educational institutions:
- Special arrangements may be made for supervised use
- Teachers must obtain parental consent
- School administration must oversee usage
- Additional privacy protections will be implemented
- Direct contact with support is required

7.6 Content Guidelines

To protect young users, we:
- Monitor content for age-appropriate material
- Remove inappropriate content
- Block certain features for youth safety
- Implement reporting tools
- Maintain family-friendly standards

7.7 Reporting Concerns

Anyone can report concerns about underage users by:
- Using our reporting system
- Emailing info@jroverton.com
- Contacting platform administrators
- Flagging suspicious content
- Notifying us of potential violations

8. Changes to This Policy

8.1 Policy Updates

We may update this privacy policy:
- To reflect changes in our practices
- To comply with new regulations
- To address new features or services
- To improve clarity and understanding
- As needed for platform operations

8.2 Notification of Changes

When we make changes:
- Significant changes will be announced via email
- Updates will be posted on our website
- The "Last Updated" date will be modified
- Users may be required to acknowledge changes
- A changelog will be maintained for transparency

8.3 Review Period

For major changes:
- Users will be given 30 days notice before implementation
- Changes will be clearly highlighted
- Previous versions will remain accessible
- Users can review and compare changes
- Questions about changes will be addressed

8.4 Your Rights Regarding Changes

When we update the policy:
- You have the right to review changes
- You can choose to accept or reject changes
- Rejecting changes may limit account access
- You can delete your account if you disagree
- You can request clarification about changes

8.5 Communication Methods

We will notify users of changes through:
- Email notifications
- Website announcements
- Account notifications
- Blog posts (when applicable)
- Platform updates

8.6 Documentation of Changes

We maintain:
- A history of policy versions
- Summaries of significant changes
- Dates of updates
- Explanations of major revisions
- Archives of previous policies

8.7 Continuous Improvement

We regularly:
- Review our privacy practices
- Update security measures
- Incorporate user feedback
- Adapt to new technologies
- Enhance user privacy protections

9. Security Practices and User Responsibilities

9.1 Platform Security

We maintain security through:
- Regular security audits
- System monitoring
- Encrypted connections (HTTPS)
- Secure server configuration
- Regular software updates

9.2 User Responsibilities

To maintain account security, you should:
- Create a strong, unique password
- Never share your login credentials
- Keep security questions private
- Log out from shared devices
- Report suspicious activity immediately

9.3 Password Guidelines

We recommend passwords that:
- Are at least 12 characters long
- Combine letters, numbers, and symbols
- Avoid personal information
- Are not used on other websites
- Are changed periodically

9.4 Best Practices

For optimal security:
- Enable two-factor authentication if available
- Use a password manager
- Check your account activity regularly
- Keep your email address current
- Be cautious with public networks

9.5 Account Protection

Users are responsible for:
- All activity under their account
- Maintaining their password security
- Keeping recovery information updated
- Reporting unauthorized access
- Following security guidelines

9.6 Incident Reporting

If you notice suspicious activity:
- Contact us immediately at info@jroverton.com
- Change your password
- Review recent account activity
- Check for unauthorized changes
- Follow our security team's instructions

9.7 Liability Limitations

Please understand that:
- We cannot guarantee absolute security
- Users are responsible for their own actions
- We are not liable for compromised credentials
- Security depends on user practices
- Some risks are inherent to internet use

10. Contact Information

10.1 How to Reach Us

You can contact Yet Another Wiki by:
- Email: info@jroverton.com
- Owner: John Overton
- Website: YetAnotherWiki.com
Response time is typically within 2 business days

10.2 Privacy Concerns

For privacy-specific issues:
- Use the subject line "Privacy Concern" in emails
- Include your account username (if applicable)
- Provide relevant details about your concern
- Specify if it's time-sensitive
- Include any relevant screenshots or documentation

10.3 Security Reports

To report security vulnerabilities:
- Email us immediately at info@jroverton.com
- Use the subject line "Security Alert"
- Provide detailed information about the issue
- Include steps to reproduce the problem
- Do not share vulnerability details publicly

10.4 Account Support

For account-related assistance:
- Include your username
- Describe your issue clearly
- Provide relevant timestamps
- Mention any error messages
- Use clear subject lines

10.5 Legal Inquiries

For legal matters:
- Send formal requests to info@jroverton.com
- Include any relevant documentation
- Provide deadline requirements
- Include your contact information
- State the nature of your inquiry

10.6 Response Times

We strive to respond:
- Within 24 hours for security issues
- Within 2 business days for privacy concerns
- Within 2 business days for account support
- Within 5 business days for general inquiries
- As required by law for legal requests

10.7 Business Hours

Our support team is available:
- Monday through Friday
- During normal business hours (9 AM - 5 PM EST)
- Excluding major US holidays
- With monitoring for urgent security issues
- With flexibility for emergency situations
